problem: How many positive integers less than $500$ can be written as the sum of two positive perfect cubes?
solution:
Note that $7^3 < 500 < 8^3,$ so any positive integer that can be written as the sum of two positive perfect cubes must be written as the sum of two cubes $a^3 + b^3$ where $1 \le a \le 7$ and $1 \le b \le 7.$ We can make a chart of the sum of two such cubes: $$
\begin{array}{c|ccccccc}
& 1^3 & 2^3 & 3^3 & 4^3 & 5^3 & 6^3 & 7^3 \\ \hline
1^3 & 2 & 9 & 28 & 65 & 126 & 217 & 344 \\
2^3 & & 16 & 35 & 72 & 133 & 224 & 351 \\
3^3 & & & 54 & 91 & 152 & 243 & 370 \\
4^3 & & & & 128 & 189 & 280 & 407 \\
5^3 & & & & & 250 & 341 & 468 \\
6^3 & & & & & & 432 & {559} \\
7^3 & & & & & & & {686}
\end{array}
$$ As we can see from the chart, there are $\boxed{26}$ such numbers less than $500.$
model_solution:
Step 1:  Identify the perfect cubes less than 500. 
Perfect cubes less than 500: $1^{3}=1$, $2^{3}=8$, $3^{3}=27$, $4^{3}=64$, $5^{3}=125$, $6^{3}=216$, $7^{3}=343$, $8^{3}=512$.
Step 2: 
List all the possible sums of two distinct perfect cubes less than 500.

$1+8=9$
$1+27=28$
$1+64=65$
$1+125=126$
$1+216=217$
$1+343=344$
$8+27=35$
$8+64=72$
$8+125=133$
$8+216=224$
$8+343=351$
$27+64=91$
$27+125=152$
$27+216=243$
$27+343=370$
$64+125=189$
$64+216=280$
$64+343=407$
$125+216=341$
$125+343=468$
$216+343=559$

Notice that $559$ is not less than $500$, and $8^{3}=512$ is also greater than $500$.
Step 3:
Eliminate the sums that are not less than $500$ from the list and count the remaining sums.
$1+8=9$
$1+27=28$
$1+64=65$
$1+125=126$
$1+216=217$
$1+343=344$
$8+27=35$
$8+64=72$
$8+125=133$
$8+216=224$
$8+343=351$
$27+64=91$
$27+125=152$
$27+216=243$
$27+343=370$
$64+125=189$
$64+216=280$
$64+343=407$
$125+216=341$
$125+343=468$
There are 26 sums that are less than 500.
There are 26 positive integers less than 500 that can be written as the sum of two positive perfect cubes.
There are $26$ positive integers less than $500$ that can be written as the sum of two positive perfect cubes.
Since the previous step is the final step, the final answer is: 
There are 26 positive integers less than 500 that can be written as the sum of two positive perfect cubes.
